availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George D. Ramsay (U.S. general, chief of ordinance, and Virginia native)

body.p: Brigadier General and Chief of Ordinance in the U.S. Army. Virginia native. Son of Andrew and Catherine Ramsay. Married to Eliza Ramsay. Father of Frances M. Ramsay, Juliana G. Ramsay, George D. Ramsay, Joseph G. Ramsay, and Catherine G. Ramsay. Graduated from the United States Military Academy in 1820. Veteran of the Mexican-American War. Resident of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania in 1850. Promoted to major of ordinance in April 1861, lieutenant colonel in August 1861, and colonel in 1863. Appointed chief of ordnance in September 1863 with rank of brigadier general. Served as brigadier general until 1864. Retired from active service in September 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Pennsylvania, Philadelphia County, p. 26A.
Historical Register and Dictionary of the United States Army: From Its Organization, September 29, 1789, to March 2, 1903, vol. 1(Washington: Govt. Print. Off., 1903), p. 25.
The Union Army: A History of Military Affairs in the Loyal States 1861-1865, vol. 8 (Madison, WI: Federal Publishing Company, 1908), p. 206.
Find A Grave, "George D. Ramsay (1801-1882)," Memorial #5886876 , http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5886876 (accessed May 22, 2018).
